Utterance: Hi there! It’s great to see you again. How have things been since our last session?
Pretty good! I’ve been trying out that breathing exercise, and it really helps.
I’m so glad to hear that! Have you noticed any changes in how you feel when you practice it?
Yeah, I feel less anxious, especially when I’m working on my car or dealing with stress.
That’s fantastic! It sounds like you’re making progress. How about your goal of researching business classes? Were you able to look into that?
I did! I found a couple of classes at a community college nearby.
That’s great news! What did you think about the classes you found?
They seem interesting. I’m thinking of signing up for one that focuses on small business management.
That sounds like a perfect fit for you! How does it feel to take this step toward your dream?
It feels exciting but also a bit scary. I’m not sure if I’ll be good at it.
It’s completely normal to feel that way when stepping out of your comfort zone. Remember, learning is a process, and everyone starts somewhere. What do you think you can do to prepare for the class?
I could try to read some books about running a business and maybe talk to some friends who own businesses.
Those are excellent ideas! Engaging with others who have experience can provide valuable insights. Have you had any conversations with your friends about their businesses?
Not yet, but I plan to ask them next time we hang out.
That sounds like a great plan. It can also help strengthen your support network. Speaking of support, how has your relationship with your wife been lately?
It’s been better! I’ve been trying to use those “I” statements, and it’s helped.
That’s wonderful to hear! Effective communication can really improve relationships. How does she respond when you express your feelings that way?
She seems to understand me better, and we don’t argue as much.
That’s a significant improvement! It’s great that you’re both working towards better communication. Have you noticed any changes in your overall mood since implementing these strategies?
Yeah, I feel more relaxed and less frustrated.
That’s fantastic! It seems like you’re making some positive changes in your life. Is there anything else you’d like to focus on today?
I’ve been thinking about my past and how I still feel guilty about some things.
It’s okay to reflect on the past, but it’s also important to find ways to let go of that guilt. What do you think is holding you back from moving on?
I guess I just keep replaying those moments in my head, wishing I could change them.
That’s understandable. Have you considered ways to reframe those memories? Instead of focusing on guilt, you could think about what you learned from those experiences.
I haven’t thought about it that way. I guess I could try that.
It can be a helpful exercise. By focusing on the lessons, you can turn those negative feelings into opportunities for growth. Would you like to try reframing one of those memories now?
Sure, let’s do that.
Great! Can you think of a specific experience that stands out to you?
Yeah, there was this time I got a ticket for speeding. I felt so stupid.
Let’s try to reframe that. What did you learn from that experience?
I learned to be more aware of my speed and to drive more safely.
Exactly! You took a lesson from that moment. Now, how does it feel to think about it that way?
It feels better. I don’t feel as guilty anymore.
I’m glad to hear that! Remember, reframing can be a powerful tool to help you move forward. Is there anything else you’d like to discuss before we wrap up?
No, I think that’s it for today.
Alright, thank you for sharing your thoughts with me today. Keep practicing your breathing, and I look forward to hearing more about your progress in our next session!
Thank you, Ellie. See you next time!
